subject: Re: [junit] displaying multiple errors from the same condition
msgSnippet: ... I believe that if you search with Google, you ll find a lot of results. Try keywords junit multiple assertion failures . The short answer: there is a way
messageBody:
kmjosey wrote:

> I have a test that pings a URL to see if a webservice is available.
>
> I do not want the test to have be aware of the specific URLs being
> tested. I go to the database where the URLs are stored and then open a
> URL connection and ping the service.
>
> I iterate through the URLs, and collect the results. I want to be able
> to display a message for all the URLs that fail. But I cannot see how
> to do that.
>
> This test only does on thing, so I don't think this is a case where I
> need to break up the test. Also I don't want to have to be aware of
> what URLs fail before hand by checking specific URLs with assertEquals.
>
> Is there a way I can display multiple errors or failures, in Junit?
> I have read the FAQ about the logic for not being able to display
> multiple results, but I don't feel like the argument is applicable here.
>
> If there is a previous response, please fowared the message id, when
> searched I kept getting 'search timed out, only partial results'.

I believe that if you search with Google, you'll find a lot of results.
Try keywords "junit multiple assertion failures".

The short answer: there is a way to make JUnit do this, but many of us
don't like to do it that way. For a test like this, I might do the
following:

List failedUrls = new ArrayList();
foreach (URL url : urlsToTest) {
if (failed(url)) {
failedUrls.add(url);
}
}
assertTrue(failedUrls.isEmpty());
